intro: Pseuduvaria rhytidocarpa, commonly known as the rough-skinned pseuduvaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants known for their diverse chemical compounds. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. Its small, clustered flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
